quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am on a lecture circuit. I'm goin' around to all the branches, and I'm telling them my secret recipe for success.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have now memorized all of your names. Shirty, Mole, Lazy Eye, Mexico, Baldy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [holding a chainsaw] And I turn it on and I say 'Prepare yourself for the Utica Chainsaw Massacre.'

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: How's Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: We're engaged.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh my God, I'm so happy for you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, wow, thank you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You remember Holly? She used to work for HR? She's the love of my life. She just left... and I never got closure. And I feel like I need to go to Nashua and get closure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: ... Okay, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [Kevin is holding two ice cream treats] Two?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I didn't eat lunch. [Oscar gives Kevin a look] I didn't eat all my lunch.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [enters smiling and waving] Hello, everyone. Oh, ice cream. Nice, Kevin. Looks good.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It... yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Angela, you're more chipper than usual.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I am proud to announce that there is a new addition to the Martin family. [takes a breath, excitedly] She's hypoallergenic. She doesn't struggle when you try to dress her. She's a third-generation show cat. Her father was in 'Meet the Parents.' Needless to say, she was very, very expensive.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: How much?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Seven thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: For a cat? I could get you a kid for that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Where'd you get that kind of money?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I sold Andy's engagement ring on eBay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Wait, you didn't give it back?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: He wouldn't have wanted that. Her name is Princess Lady!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Seven grand?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I gotta see that little bitch.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I have something better than a picture. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You have your cats on Nanny-Cam?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yeah. [cats meowing] I mean, I usually try to take leave when I get a new cat, but I'm out of vacation days. And this company still doesn't recognize cat maternity. I mean, when somebody has a kid, oh sure, take off a year.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: She's right. I had my second kid just for the vacation.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Right. Anyways... I just want to make sure Princess Lady is acclimating well. She means more to me than anyone.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Any cat, you mean.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And person.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, detour. We're now adding Nashua to the Lecture Circuit so Michael can confront Holly and get some closure. Nashua actually sounded very excited on the phone. I don't think they get a lot of visitors. Because their office is only accessible by cross-country skis. Hey-oh! [laughs] [whispers] I've been driving too long.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [shouts from another room] What did you do?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Stop yelling at me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What did you do?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I didn't do anything!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What did you learn in there? I bet you learned things, huh? Like how to fashion a shiv, hmm?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey! What the hell's goin' on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Why don't you tell Jim where you were from ages 14 to 15.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I was kickin' it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: In juvie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Juvie... nile... Detention Center. Where they send teenagers!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: For reha-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What did you do? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight, sounds like she was 14, so maybe we wanna go a little easy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, if she's old enough to get married, she's old enough to follow the law. [to Kelly] What did you do?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: My boyfriend dumped me, so, I stole his boat. I mean, he told me it was his boat. It was actually his father's. And I just thought it'd be really romantic, like 'Thelma and Louise,' but with, like, a boat. And it was the worst year of my life. And I can't believe that you guys are making me talk about this on my birthday!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I thought you said yesterday was your birthday!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, you know what? I got you a cake.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You did? I wanna see the cake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And... ta da.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I hate it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How do you hate it? It's a cake.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Well, there's no flowers... or toys... or--- I mean, there's nothing on it. Where did you even find a cake like this? I mean, it doesn't have my name on it! Do you guys know what my name is? My name is Kelly!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I forgot if there was an "e" between the "l" and the "y." I still don't know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I mean, I don't even know what the theme is. What's the theme?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Birthday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Frosting.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Those aren't... themes. There's always a theme. [walks out]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: There's always a theme.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nice job on the cake, Bozo!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, you know what, next time, I'll let you get the cake and I get to scream at the birthday girl.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [taking Michael's picture] Okay, a little bit more closer to the sign. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do I look okay?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You look good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Hi, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, you can. I am, uh, Michael Scott, Regional Manager of the Scranton branch.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Yes, we were expecting you. Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you. ... Um... is, uh, Holly Flax anywhere here?

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Actually, she's on an HR retreat for the next three days.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh- She's not here?

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: But, if you need to get in touch with her immediately, you could talk to A.J. He's a salesman here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A.J.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Yeah, he's her boyfriend. He's just over there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She has a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm so sorry, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How could she do this to me, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: She's not doing it to hurt you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I can't do the presentation, I can't- [voice cracks] ... just... oh... thinking about seeing him... and... thinking about... him getting to hold her and getting to kiss her, it just- oh, God! [starts crying, covers his face]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Listen, when Jim was dating Karen, I didn't want to come to work. It was awful. I hated it. I wanted to quit, but-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, just... uh, please, I'm going through something, okay? [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You know, when Holly gets back, everyone will tell her what a great job you did. And then she'll realize what she's missing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And then she'll move back to Scranton. And her boyfriend will die.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Maybe. One step at a time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You can do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I can do this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It could be snacks, or-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Why would we- [cats meowing from Angela's computer, sounds like crying]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Wha-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Is that what I think it is? [Kevin and Oscar get up and go to Angela's computer]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Good God!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [gasps]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [gasps]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That one ugly cat is humping Princess Lady!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Stop it, Mr. Ash! Bad cat! That is very bad! You stop it right now! I swear, he is fixed.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Yeah, I know fixed; that ain't fixed.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, now listen. You can't let what you see here, sully your image of them. They are good, decent cats. [all laugh] I gotta go. I'll be back in an hour. Oh, stop that! Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, the other one's watching.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, so all we need is a theme... and cups, and ice, and punch, and a cake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Busy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, what's that show that she's always talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, my God. Is this how you are with Pam? 'Cause she must want to shoot herself in the face.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what? I could use a little help.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? I'm a little busy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We have a lot to do, and you are... putting up a very effeminate sign. Is that what you've been doing, is making a sign?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's not effeminate. It's festive.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You've been making that sign, for something that we could just announce to the whole office? Hey everybody, the party's now at 3!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I know, I just read it on the sign.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Goooood morning, Viet-Nashua! Sales. Sales is what bwings us together, today. How do we deal with clients who say, "Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn... about paper" and get them to "Show us the money!" Well, we are going to find out today. Show of hands. How many of you are salesmen? Let's see the salesmen. [some raise their hands] Oh, okay. Well I know what the rest of you are thinking. Wow, yuck. Salesmen are the worst! They are awful. They are so arrogant. They think the whole place revolves around them. Handsome, good listeners, funny, Mr. Wonderful. So, okay, you're a salesman. What's, uh, what's your name?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: A.J.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: A.J. What kind of name is A.J.?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What do you race cars?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: [laughs] I'm a salesman. That's why I raised my hand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ooh. Ouch. Okay, good. You're funny, very good and funny. Tell me, A.J., are you dating? Is there somebody you date?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: Yeah. Why, are you interested? [all laugh]

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.line: I have a question about discounts from distributors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep, we will get to you. Okay, so you're dating somebody? Um... is it serious?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: It's pretty serious, yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Huh- [pauses] Does she ever talk about me? [voice cracking]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: What does this have to do with sales?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's all connected. Shut up. [to A.J.] Does she ever mention 'Michael Scott?'

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: No, what are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs loudly] Does it feel good?

quotes.speaker: A.J.
quotes.line: Does what feel good?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [grunts] Your life. [sits down, upset] Oh, wow. Whew. Ahh, legs are sorta giving out. Long drive in the car, so let's just- We'll just continue. [sighs, falls to floor, gets more upset] Oh, wow. [takes deep breath] Ooh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael, get off the floor!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah... uh, I can't do this Pam. Just read from- just read the cards.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispering] No, no, no, you have to do it-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, I'm okay. I'm all right. [sighs heavily] Okay... okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That was weird, huh? It's all part of the presentation. It was confusing, right? Because confusing situations happen to us all the time in our jobs. [pauses] I'm just trying to bridge the gap between what just happened and the fact that I'm going to be doing the rest of the presentation.  [reading from the cards, in Forrest Gump voice] Sales is like a box a chocolates, you never know which vendor you're gonna get. Forrest Gump.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pointing to staff members] Blazer. Freckles. Penguin. K.D. Lang. Holly's boyfriend. These mnemonic devices help to make a connection, and then, also to help you memorize names. I have a chainsaw! [holds up chainsaw, makes a wimpy chain saw noise] Cutting down the competition.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [cats meowing in background][on Nanny-Cam] Where is that bad cat? Oh, you know who you are. Excuse me, Petals, I'm looking for Mr. Ash. He's a bad cat. Bad, bad cat. Do you hear me? Bad. Yeah, you were bad. No, you look at me when I talk to you. Do you hear me, Mr. Ash? You look at me. 'Cause I'm talking to you right now.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [snickers]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [meows like a cat, then hisses]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: This is getting weird.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Is she cleaning the cat with her tongue? [Angela licks cat, meows]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ohhh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sighs, touches Holly's sweater, cuts off sleeve, chuckles, sees Word document on Holly's computer named "Dear Michael," plugs in USB flash drive to copy file from computer]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [shivers] [meowing noises] Has this been on the entire time?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I was looking at pictures of food on my computer.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [sigh of relief] Well, sorry I'm late. [clears throat, coughs, pulls hairball out of her mouth]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I want to get that image out of my head. The psychological issues that go behind licking a cat, are not things I want to go into. Also, I'm pretty sure she coughed up a hairball.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [loading up car with Michael] Don't look up. Don't look up. [sighs as office workers all looking from window]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Want some pie?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I went through Holly's things.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I stole a sleeve of her sweater.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I also stole something off of her computer. A document called "Dear Michael."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You did what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I shouldn't have done it. It just- I couldn't help it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: She never sent it to you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, sh- she didn't. I'm gonna read it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, under no circumstances can you read that letter. It's a violation of her trust.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Because, she didn't send it to you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know. You're right, you're right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I could read it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, that wouldn't-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I could read it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, you don't have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Go get your laptop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. [leaves to get laptop]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [to camera] What? I'm not in love with her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [blowing up balloon, breathes loudly] You have to write my suggestions down, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm not writing, "Horse Hunt." I don't even know what that means.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's in the name.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [grunts] Okay, so far, our ideal party consists of beer, fights to the death, cupcakes, blood pudding, blood, touch football, mating, charades, and yes, horse hunting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're right, forget horse hunting. It's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Look, is there a birthday you remember that you loved?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Here's one. It was dark, warm, wet. A sudden burst of light. An intense pressure like I'd never felt before. Father, dressed in white, pulls me forward. Mother bites the cord. [pretends to bite]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, stop. Forever stop that story. That's disgusting, and it doesn't count. So give me another one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Schrutes don't celebrate birthdays, idiot. It started as a Depression-era practicality, and then moved on to an awesome tradition that I look forward to every year. [rolls eyes] What about you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Actually, when I was seven, my Dad took me to the Natural History Museum in New York. And we looked at fossils all day. And at the end of the day, he got me a little plastic triceratops. It was awesome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's cool. Hey, you know what's even cooler than triceratops? Every other dinosaur that ever existed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to camera] Didn't see that one coming.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [closes laptop] It's deleted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: She still has feelings for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She said that? Is that what it said? What did it say?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I can't tell you specifically, but... it's not over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You're sure?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [nods and smiles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [smiles, sighs, chuckles] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [enters conference room]

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Happy Birthday!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Surprise!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, it's not a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: This doesn't look good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?! You have a cake. You have a delicious cake, with your name spelled correctly?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [shakes her head no]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Told you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You haven't heard our theme, though.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You don't hear a theme, you see it... why is there a chicklet on my cake?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's the best part. That represents a pillow, or a television.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Our theme, if you will.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because the fun part is, you get to decide on an hour of television, or an hour of napping.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's our theme.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I love it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [high-fives Jim] Oh, yes! Okay, good. So what's it gonna be, Kapoor?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ooh- can she pick a half hour of each?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, then pick TV.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Take a nap!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: TV.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, watching TV at work is really cool.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Take a nap, nothing good is on TV right now.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Bonnie Hunt is on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You know what, I have been watching TV all week. I choose nap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, nap it is! Everyone out! Get out! We're gonna be eating cake at our desks. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Surprise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Move it! Let's go, go, go, go, go. I got this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ahem. This is for you... and [puts blanket around her shoulders] ...Happy Birthday, Kel.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [giggles] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [turns off lights] Okay, you've got one hour. [shuts door]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I'm too excited to sleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mm, great cake.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks. [both eat cake]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [opens door to wake Kelly, bangs together two trash can covers loudly] Birthday time is over! Now go make up for all the work you missed when you were taking your nap. [slaps Kelly's butt] Many happy returns. [slams door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I feel great. So good to have closure. Ah! We should go apologize to Roy or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, we don't need to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Who have I wronged? Who have I wronged? Oh, oh! What about that fat guy from Stamford that I insulted? We should find him!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You mean Tony?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jabba the hut, Pizza the hut, Fat guys like pizza, pepperoni pizza, pepperoni Tony!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Man, was he fat. So, so... fat. You know what, forget it. I know me. When I saw him, I would never be able to apologize to him. Too fat. Big fat fatty.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: As you may know, I am no longer in a relationships. It's been really stressful here. So, I decided to treat myself to one of God's most perfect creations...a beautiful new cat! It's tacky to talk about money. But she cost seven thousand dollars!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [holds up cell phone showing video of Angela talking to her cats] For a rainy day. [laughs]
